page.title: 08Events.
page.content: Life in 1920's- Memories of Ken Stott. Attended East Witton School. About 70 children & 2 teachers. Children began aged 5; left aged 14. School closed 3 yrs due to diphtheria. 2 children died - Books & equipment burnt. No school lunches; children played on Green. Outside toilets; cold & smelly. Child- ren punished with ruler or cane. He recalls following the foxhounds up the Fell without teacher's permission and being hit with the ruler on his return -Always frightened of tramps & gypsies with their dogs. Lived at Cover Bridge Inn. Only men allowed in the bar. Ladies went in the kitchen. No running water or electricity. Toilet at bottom of garden. Busy, noisy pub. Ken Stott retired last year as Head of St. Aidan's School, Harrogate. Now lives in bungalow next to Cover Bridge Inn.
